Package com.example.backend.controller

Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
com.example.backend.controller.AuthController
@CrossOrigin(origins={"http://localhost:3000","http://localhost:5173"}) @RestController @RequestMapping("/") public class AuthController extends Object
The AuthController class serves as the controller for handling all HTTP requests related to user authentication and authorization. This class utilizes the UserService, TokenService and JWTUtils for performing authentication operations. It handles CORS requests from specified local addresses.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AuthController(UserService userService, TokenService tokenService, JWTUtils jwtUtils)
    The AuthController constructor which is autowired by Spring (via the @Autowired annotation) to provide an instance of UserService, TokenService and JWTUtils.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthController

      @Autowired public AuthController(UserService userService, TokenService tokenService, JWTUtils jwtUtils)
      The AuthController constructor which is autowired by Spring (via the @Autowired annotation) to provide an instance of UserService, TokenService and JWTUtils.
      Parameters:
      userService - The service that handles operations related to User objects.
      tokenService - The service that handles operations related to Token objects.
      jwtUtils - The utility class for generating and verifying JWT tokens.

  • Method Details

    • register

      @PostMapping(path="/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> register(@RequestBody User user)
      The register method handles the user registration process. It accepts a User object as a request body, hashes the user password using BCrypt and saves the user to the database.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be registered.
      Returns:
      A response entity with a message indicating the user registration status.

    • handleLogin

      @PostMapping(path="/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthResponse> handleLogin(@RequestBody LoginRequest loginRequest, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      The handleLogin method is responsible for user authentication. It accepts a LoginRequest object as a request body and authenticates the user credentials.
      Parameters:
      loginRequest - The request body containing user login credentials.
      response - The HttpServletResponse object.
      Returns:
      A response entity with an AuthResponse object that includes an access token and user roles.

    • handleRefreshToken

      @GetMapping("/refresh") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AuthResponse> handleRefreshToken(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      The handleRefreshToken method handles the process of generating a new access token using a refresh token.
      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest object.
      Returns:
      A response entity with an AuthResponse object that includes a new access token and user roles.

    • handleLogout

      @GetMapping("/logout") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleLogout(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      The handleLogout method handles the process of user logout. It clears the refresh token from the user cookies and deletes the refresh token from the database.
      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest object.
      response - The HttpServletResponse object.
      Returns:
      A response entity with a message indicating the user logout status.
